attributes.magic: PE32+ executable (console) x86-64, for MS Windows

threat_severity.level_description: Severity HIGH because it was considered ransomware. Other contributing factors were that it has known exploits and it could not be run in sandboxes.

crowdsourced_yara_results.author: Felix Bilstein - yara-signator at cocacoding dot com

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Deletion of Volume Shadow Copies via WMI with PowerShell - PS Script
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects deletion of Windows Volume Shadow Copies with PowerShell code and Get-WMIObject. This technique is used by numerous ransomware families such as Sodinokibi/REvil

match_context.values: @{ScriptBlockText=Get-WmiObject Win32_Shadowcopy | Remove-WmiObject; MessageTotal=1; ScriptBlockId=cf0c04d6-5643-4263-9256-05f27ed9d2eb; Path=; MessageNumber=1; EventID=4104}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Deletion of Volume Shadow Copies via WMI with PowerShell
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects deletion of Windows Volume Shadow Copies with PowerShell code and Get-WMIObject. This technique is used by numerous ransomware families such as Sodinokibi/REvil

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Potential WMI Lateral Movement WmiPrvSE Spawned PowerShell
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects Powershell as a child of the WmiPrvSE process. Which could be a sign of lateral movement via WMI.

match_context.values: @{TerminalSessionId=1; ProcessGuid={C784477D-1E36-6475-2806-000000003400}; ProcessId=7376; Product=Microsoft\xae Windows\xae Operating System; Description=Windows PowerShell; Company=Microsoft Corporation; ParentProcessGuid={C784477D-5908-6442-5900-000000003400}; User=DESKTOP-B0T93D6\george; Hashes=MD5=95000560239032BC68B4C2FDFCDEF913,SHA256=D3F8FADE829D2B7BD596C4504A6DAE5C034E789B6A3DEFBE013BDA7D14466677,IMPHASH=741776AACCFC5B71FF59832DCDCACE0F; OriginalFileName=PowerShell.EXE; ParentImage=C:\Windows\System32\wbem\WmiPrvSE.exe; FileVersion=10.0.17134.1 (WinBuild.160101.0800); ParentProcessId=3992; CurrentDirectory=C:\Windows\system32\; CommandLine=powershell.exe -Command "Get-WmiObject Win32_Shadowcopy | Remove-WmiObject"; EventID=1; LogonGuid=C784477D-5908-6442-E9D1-030000000000; LogonId=250345; Image=C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe; IntegrityLevel=High; ParentCommandLine=C:\Windows\system32\wbem\wmiprvse.exe -secured -Embedding; UtcTime=1685397046; RuleName=-}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: PowerShell Module File Created By Non-PowerShell Process
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects the creation of a new PowerShell module ".psm1", ".psd1", ".dll", ".ps1", etc. by a non-PowerShell process
Detects non-interactive PowerShell activity by looking at the "powershell" process with a non-user GUI process such as "explorer.exe" as a parent.

match_context.values: @{Hashes=MD5=04029E121A0CFA5991749937DD22A1D9,SHA256=9F914D42706FE215501044ACD85A32D58AAEF1419D404FDDFA5D3B48F66CCD9F,IMPHASH=7C955A0ABC747F57CCC4324480737EF7; CurrentDirectory=C:\Windows\system32\; OriginalFileName=PowerShell.EXE; Product=Microsoft\xae Windows\xae Operating System; Description=Windows PowerShell; FileVersion=10.0.19041.546 (WinBuild.160101.0800); ParentCommandLine=C:\Windows\system32\wbem\wmiprvse.exe -secured -Embedding; CommandLine=powershell.exe -Command "Get-WmiObject Win32_Shadowcopy | Remove-WmiObject"; EventID=1; ParentImage=C:\Windows\System32\wbem\WmiPrvSE.exe; IntegrityLevel=High; Image=C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe; Company=Microsoft Corporation}
